page.title: 14Free Time in Ponteland
page.content: We interviewed a few Ponteland people aged between 15 and 70 about their leisure activities.Most people spoken to participated in some sports.Indoor ones,such as squash and badminton are offered at the{Sports Centre}and were the most popular.Our speakers also enjoyed more solitary activities such as jogging and walking.The people we spoke to rarely venture from home to watch either live sport or visit the theatre or cinema.this points to the growing power of television,which brings events into the home at a lower cost than attending in person.Indeed watching television proved to be the most popular recreation in the home, although most people enjoy reading and gardening.Few of the more traditional activities-painting drawing,handcrafts were practised.Visiting friends,places relatives,restaurant & pub were common
